name: Long Meadow Creek
description:
This short canyon drops quickly off a large headwall, and has numerous pools along the way. Since the drainage is small, an early season run will be more sporty with cold waterflow.

Approach

Descent

Exit

Follow down the Kings for a 1/4 mile then climb up North of a big granite headwall following cairns and a faint use trail. (GPS track coming soon to the KML map file).

Red tape

Beta sites

Trip reports and media

We explored 2 exit paths on 29JUL2021 and took pictures (banner of the headwall), but have yet to run the canyon itself. We downclimbed the final short drops to the North Fork of the Kings River.

Background
